abstract: Environmental Protection Agency issues landmark report finding no direct evidence that hydraulic fracturing is harming nation's water supply, though potential exists for contamination; cites several instances in which fracking chemicals found their way into drinking water wells, though cases made up minority.
lead_paragraph: The agency said that though it had found no evidence that hydraulic fracturing has had a widespread effect on drinking water, it has the potential.

headline.main: Fracking Has Not Had Big Effect on Water Supply, E.P.A. Says While Noting Risks
headline.print_headline: Report Finds No Effect on Water Supply From Fracking, but Warns of Potential

snippet: The agency said that though it had found no evidence that hydraulic fracturing has had a widespread effect on drinking water, it has the potential.
